title: How to Make a Lalaloopsy Doll

steps.headline: Get two skin colored socks, stuffing, buttons, needle, thread, and/or sewing machine.
Get one sock and make a stuffing ball.
steps.description: Place it at the top. Tie a knot under it and place the stuffing back in and sew it closed.

steps.headline: For the legs, take the end and sew a straight line but not all the way to the top.
steps.description: Sew another, but let them touch.

steps.headline: Take your other sock and make two arms by cutting two thick strips.
steps.description: With a seam allowance, sew the long side shut and stuff it.

steps.headline: Take the sock with the head and make a cut on each side for the arms start small you can enlarge it if needed.
steps.description: Place the arms in and sew it shut.

steps.headline: Cut where the legs were not sewn in the middle.
Make a dress out of a sock.
Sew on the buttons for eyes and optional: draw on eyelashes and a mouth and use a piece of pink plush for cheeks.
Glue yarn on your doll's head for hair.

text: Get two skin colored socks, stuffing, buttons, needle, thread, and/or sewing machine.  Get one sock and make a stuffing ball. Place it at the top. Tie a knot under it and place the stuffing back in and sew it closed. For the legs, take the end and sew a straight line but not all the way to the top. Sew another, but let them touch. Take your other sock and make two arms by cutting two thick strips. With a seam allowance, sew the long side shut and stuff it. Take the sock with the head and make a cut on each side for the arms start small you can enlarge it if needed. Place the arms in and sew it shut. Cut where the legs were not sewn in the middle.  Make a dress out of a sock.  Sew on the buttons for eyes and optional: draw on eyelashes and a mouth and use a piece of pink plush for cheeks.  Glue yarn on your doll's head for hair.  Name her and have fun.
